content: So, every time I'm reviewing a pull request I see that green merge button looking at me like "yep, you're gonna click me someday". If I'm not mistaken, rust-lang/rust uses protected branches, should we do the same? AFAIK we always use bors anyway.

The master branch is already protected. We could add a rule, that only bors can push to the master branch, though (@Manish Goregaokar). Every other branch we can't protect, since force pushes are sometimes required.

Every other branch we can't protect, since force pushes are sometimes required

Yeah the idea would be to avoid accidentally merging a PR to master, if possible. I think it can be reverted right away, but better prevent that lament :smile:
